properties.areaDesc: Santa Fe Metro Area; Northwest Highlands; Upper Rio Grande Valley; Middle Rio Grande Valley/Albuquerque Metro Area; West Central Highlands; West Central Mountains; Espanola Valley
properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 15 at 10:00PM MST until January 17 at 8:00AM MST by NWS Albuquerque NM
properties.description:
...WINTER STORM TO BRING HEAVY SNOW TO THE NORTHERN MOUNTAINS AND
FREEZING RAIN TO PORTIONS OF THE EASTERN PLAINS THURSDAY INTO
THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY...

.A complex winter storm system will bring several inches of snow
to northern New Mexico. The highest snow accumulations will be
found above 7500 feet with accumulations ranging from 6 to
10 inches and over a foot possible on mountain peaks. Very strong
westerly winds on Friday may also create areas of blowing snow
across northern New Mexico. This winter storm system will also be
responsible for areas of freezing rain across portions of the
east-central plains Thursday morning and Thursday night. Total ice
accumulations will range from 0.05 to 0.10 inches will locally
higher amounts possible.

* WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 3
inches except up to 7 inches above 6500 feet.

* WHERE...Northwest Highlands, West Central Mountains, West
Central Highlands, Upper Rio Grande Valley, Espanola Valley,
Santa Fe Metro Area and Middle Rio Grande Valley including the
Albuquerque Metro Area.

* WHEN...From 5 AM Thursday to 8 AM MST Friday.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions for New Mexico can be obtained by
calling 5 1 1, 1-800-432-4269, or visiting nmroads.com.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 5 AM THURSDAY TO 8 AM MST FRIDAY
